topic.title: Overview reports
topic.p: This is a %qd% report in the %product% UI.
This report contains the following information fields (listed from top to bottom):

list.li: Project name and location. Location is displayed if a project is hosted on a publicly available repository like GitHub.
Branch name, if this information is accessible. This field is configurable, so you can upload information about different branches or use a different criteria for grouping reports.
Commit hash, if this information is accessible.
Date and time when a repository was analyzed.
Bar chart reflects the problems found during the five recent code analyses. The rightmost bar displays the latest inspection results.

topic.p: %product% displays %qd% reports either in a separate or in a merged (aggregated) forms.
Merged reports display all problems that their reports contained. Repeating problems will be duplicated.
Project without reports can also be deleted.

chapter.title: Generate a token
chapter.p: Tokens are used for uploading %qd% reports to %product%.
After generation, this token needs to be added as a %qd% parameter to upload it to %product%.

note.p: If %qd% reports have the same branch name and commit time, they are displayed as a single report. If a branch name is the same but commit time varies, they will be displayed as separate reports.
In case several reports are related to the same commit hash, they are displayed as a single report.

chapter.p: To see the detailed report about a specific analysis, click the bar in the bar chart. This will open the Report page.
For more details about %qd% reports, see the User interface overview section of the %qd% documentation.
